trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> objects which persist in a Windows Address Book.
This class has no public constructors, since a reference to it is returned by the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerCollaboration> class.
Address books that are associated with <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> management include those associated with the host peer and a remote peer.

Either computer may collaborate with other peers; when a peer is local to the remote peer but not the host peer, it can be added to the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> of the host peer.

Certain operations on the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> class, such as <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.AddContact%2A> and <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.DeleteContact%2A>, correlate to the associated operations being performed on the Windows Address book of the remote peer.

The host peer has access to this persistent storage for <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact> information, which can be associated with the applications in which a peer intends to participate.
A <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication> can identify itself as a user of a <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> persistent store on a computer.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> of the local peer.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance to add to <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
The specified by peerContact already exists.
peerContact is `null`.
The specified peerContact has been disposed.
The specified by peerContact could not be reconstituted from its serialized XML format.
Unable to add the local peer to the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> instance being constructed.

Raised whenever a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerApplication"></xref> associated with a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> has changed.
This method only returns applications published by contacts of the calling peer.
Before this event can be raised, the current user of the remote peer must subscribe to the collaboration events of the remote peer.
Subscription is accomplished via the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> method.
This event requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The calling object has been disposed.
Creates a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance for the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> to associate with the new <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.
A <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance for the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref>.
peerNearMe is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
The contact manager of the remote peer passed in peerNearMe could not be reached, or the contact could not be read from it.
The instance passed in peerNearMe has no endpoints set on it.
Creates a contact instance for the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> to associate with the new <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance.

A user-defined <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains information about the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.CreateContactAsync(System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe,System.Object)"></xref> operation.
It will be passed to the callback of the asynchronous operation for identification.
userToken already exists and is in use.
peerNearMe is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> object has been disposed.
The specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe"></xref> instance has no endpoints set on it.
Raised whenever a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.CreateContact(System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerNearMe)"></xref> method has completed.
This event is raised when the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.CreateContactAsync%2A> method has completed.
It is also raised if the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager> operation completes in error or is cancelled.
This event requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The calling object has been disposed.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> of the local peer.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
peerContact is `null`.

Removes the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> associated with the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> of the local peer.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to remove from the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> associated with <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref> could not be found in the contact manager.
peerName is `null`.
This object has had <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.Dispose"></xref> previously called on it and cannot be used for future operations.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.DeleteContact*"></xref> operation.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> object.
Returns the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object for the specified <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref>.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to be retrieved.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> associated with the supplied <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref>.
peerName is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref> object has been disposed.
Contact not found in <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
Unable to obtain the contact for the supplied <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref>.

Returns a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContactCollection"></xref> that contains all contacts within the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> of the remote peer.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.

<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContactCollection"></xref> that contains all contacts within the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> of the remote peer.
If the contact manager is empty, then a collection of size zero (0) is returned.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> object has been disposed.
An invalid value was returned when this method attempted to enumerate a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.Peer"></xref> in this peer contact collection.
Gets the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> representing the local peer.
Unless specified, the default value for this property is `null`.
Using this property requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> instance representing the local peer.

Raised whenever the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName"></xref> associated with a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> has changed.
The associated callback provides a reference to the new <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.PeerName%2A>.
This event requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The calling object has been disposed.
Raised whenever an object within a contact’s registered <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref> objects has changed.
Before this event can be raised, the current user of the remote peer must subscribe to the collaboration events of the host peer.
Subscription is accomplished via the PeerContact <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> methods.
This event requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerObject"></xref> object has been disposed.

Raised whenever the presence status of a <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref> has changed.
Before this event can be raised, the current user of the remote peer must subscribe to the collaboration events of the host peer.
Subscription is accomplished via the <xref:System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact.Subscribe%2A> method.
This event requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Raised when the list of subscribed contacts changes.
Since subscriptions are per user and not per process or per application domain, another application running on the host may also cause this event to be raised.
This event requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The object has been disposed.

When this property value is set, all events not fired as the result of an asynchronous operation will have the associated event handlers called back on the thread that created the specific <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerEndPoint.SynchronizingObject"></xref>.
The default set value for this property is `null`, indicating that all event handlers are called on a system thread pool thread.
This property is typically set to a UI element such as a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> instance.

Object that implements the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke"></xref> interface and is used by instances of this type for event handler synchronization on the thread that created it.
The calling object has been disposed.
Updates the data associated with the <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref>.
Calling this method requires a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>.
The <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> to be updated.
<xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> not found in <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager"></xref>.
peerContact is `null`.
This <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact"></xref> object has been disposed.
Unable to complete <xref href="System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.ContactManager.UpdateContact(System.Net.PeerToPeer.Collaboration.PeerContact)"></xref> operation.
